intro: Cullumia bisulca, commonly known as the two-ridged cullumia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the genus Cullumia within the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive ribbed or ridged appearance, giving it its scientific name. Cullumia bisulca is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
